summary: The CHAMPVA Children's Care Protection Act of 2025 aims to amend Title 38 of the United States Code. It seeks to increase the maximum age for children eligible for medical care under the CHAMPVA program to their 26th birthday, regardless of marital status.  The bill also clarifies that this expansion doesn't affect eligibility for children described in section 101(4)(A)(ii). The changes would apply to medical care provided on or after the date the act is passed.
